declarations.comments: Fetch data on mount and rerender when it's ready.
declarations.title: single

declarations.comments: Fetch data on mount and rerender when it's ready.
declarations.title: multi

declarations.comments:
A form builder where each field depends on the validity of the previous ones.
That is, every field is only displayed if all the previous ones are valid.
Forms can be turned into components using the `build` function.
declarations.title: SeqFormBuilder

declarations.comments:
An applicative functor which can be used to build forms.
Forms can be turned into components using the `build` function.
declarations.title: FormBuilder

declarations.comments:
Revalidate the form, in order to display error messages or create
a validated result.
declarations.title: revalidate

declarations.comments:
Listens for changes in a form's value and allows for performing
asynchronous effects and additional value changes.
declarations.title: listen

declarations.comments:
Invalidate a form, keeping its user interface but discarding the result
and possibly changing its type.
declarations.title: invalidate

declarations.comments:
The simplest way to create a `FormBuilder`. Create a `FormBuilder`
provided a function that, given the current value and a change callback,
renders a form element as `JSX`.
declarations.title: formBuilder_

declarations.comments:
Create a `FormBuilder` from a function which produces a form
element as `JSX` and a validated result.
declarations.title: formBuilder

declarations.comments:
A `Validator` takes a possibly invalid form `result` and produces
a `valid` result, or an error message.
declarations.title: Validator

declarations.comments:
The `Validated` type describes the state of a validated form field. This
state may be used to modify the way this form field or its validation
messages are displayed.

TODO: maybe convert this type to a record? Possible extensions to this
type (as a record) could be a field `valid :: Boolean` to display an
indicator that the field is valid, or a field
`validating :: Maybe (Canceler a)` to control form fields with asynchronous
validation.
declarations.title: Validated

declarations.comments:
Attach a validation function to a `FormBuilder p u a`, producing a new
`FormBuilder` that takes a `Validated u` as form state and displays a
warning message if its form data triggers a warning, while still allowing
the form to proceed.
declarations.title: warn

declarations.comments:
Attach a validation function to a `FormBuilder p u a`, producing a new
`FormBuilder` that takes a `Validated u` as form state and displays an
error message if its form data is invalid.

This `Validated` data type describes a form field as either `Fresh` or
`Modified`, so that validation messages are only displayed if the field
is `Modified`.
declarations.title: validated

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input can be parsed as a number.
declarations.title: validNumber

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input can be parsed as an integer.
declarations.title: validInt

declarations.comments:
Sets all `Validated` fields in a record to `Modified`, showing all
validation messages.
declarations.title: setModified

declarations.comments:
Sets all `Validated` fields in a record to `Fresh`, hiding all validation
messages.
declarations.title: setFresh

declarations.comments:
Modify a `Validator` to accept empty strings in addition to anything it
already accepts. The empty string is mapped to `Nothing`, and any other
valid input is mapped to `Just` the result of the original validator.
declarations.title: optional

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that an optional field is specified.
declarations.title: nonNull

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that an input array is non-empty.
declarations.title: nonEmptyArray

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that an input string is non-empty.
declarations.title: nonEmpty

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input equals some value.
declarations.title: mustEqual

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input fulfills a specified condition.
declarations.title: mustBe

declarations.comments: Lens for viewing and modifying `Validated` values.
declarations.title: _Validated

declarations.comments:
Create a React component for a form from a `FormBuilder`.

_Note_: this function should be fully applied, to avoid remounting
the component on each render.
declarations.title: build

declarations.comments: Create an always-valid `FormBuilder` that renders the supplied `JSX`.
declarations.title: static

declarations.comments: A formatted section header used to visually separate the parts of a form
declarations.title: section

declarations.comments: A configurable input box makes a `FormBuilder` for strings
declarations.title: inputBox

declarations.comments: A simple text box makes a `FormBuilder` for strings
declarations.title: textbox

declarations.comments: A simple password box makes a `FormBuilder` for strings
declarations.title: passwordBox

declarations.comments: A simple text box makes a `FormBuilder` for strings
declarations.title: textarea

declarations.comments: A `switch` is an editor for booleans which displays Yes or No.
declarations.title: switch

declarations.comments:
A form that edits an optional structure represented by group of radio
buttons, visually oriented in either horizontal or vertical fashion.

This is similar to `select`, but displays radio buttons instead.
declarations.title: radioGroup

declarations.comments: A editor consisting of a file picker.
declarations.title: file

declarations.comments:
given values which are composed from a sum-type, generate a select dropdown from its elements

data Yup = One | Two
genericSelect [{label: "1st", value: One}, {label: "2nd", value: Two}]
This would serialize to- and from select options automatically
declarations.title: genericSelect

declarations.comments: A editor consisting of a single-select dropdown.
declarations.title: select

declarations.comments: An editor consisting of a multi-select dropdown.
declarations.title: multiSelect

declarations.comments:
An editor which uses an API call to populate a single-select
drop-down.

The API call is made available in props using the `RowCons`
constraint. Pass an `SProxy` to specify the label where the API
call will be stored.

For example:

```purescript
asyncSelect (SProxy :: SProxy "foo")
  :: forall props additionalData
   . (Select.SelectOption additionalData -> JSX)
  -> FormBuilder
     { readonly :: Boolean
     , foo :: String -> Aff (Either String
                (Array (Select.SelectOption additionalData)))
     | props
     }
     (Maybe (Select.SelectOption))
```
declarations.title: asyncSelect

declarations.comments: Similar to `asyncSelect` but allows the current value to be specified using only its key.
declarations.title: asyncSelectByKey

declarations.comments:
A form which edits a number. The form produces a string as a result in
order to allow more control over validation (e.g. to allow special
handling of the empty string, or to distinguish 1, 1.0, and 1.00000 from
each other).

See also `validNumber` from the Validation module.
declarations.title: number

declarations.comments:
Edit an `Array` of values.

This `FormBuilder` displays a removable section for each array element,
along with an "Add..." button in the final row.
declarations.title: array

declarations.comments: Edit an `Array` of values without letting the user add or remove entries.
declarations.title: fixedSizeArray

declarations.comments:
Edit an `Array` of values.

Unlike `array`, this `FormBuilder` uses a modal popup for adding and
editing array elements.

`Note`: `arrayModal` does not support validation, in the sense that the
component _inside_ the modal popup cannot reject its form state when the
use clicks the save button.
declarations.title: arrayModal

declarations.comments:
Form that performs an asynchronous effect whenever `id` changes.
The result is `Nothing` while the effect is not completed, and a `Just`
after the value is available.
declarations.title: fetch

declarations.comments:
Performs an asynchronous effect once and returns its result encapsulated in
`Just`. The result is `Nothing` while the effect is not completed.
declarations.title: fetch_

declarations.comments:
A dummy form that, whenever the specified key changes, performs an
asynchronous effect. It displays the specified JSX while the effect is not
complete, sets the form data to the result of the effect and returns it.
declarations.title: asyncEffect

declarations.comments:
A dummy form that, whenever the specified key changes, performs an
effect. It sets the form data to the result of the effect and returns it.
declarations.title: effect

declarations.comments:
Sequential `SeqFormBuilder` used for asynchronously initializing some
piece of form data, invalidating the form and preventing the rendering of
subsequent fields while the supplied `Aff` is not completed.

For example:

```purescript
myForm = parallel do
  initializer mempty \props value -> do
    foo <- fetchDefaultFoo
    pure $ value
      { foo = foo
      , bar = props.bar
      }

  sequential ado
    foo <- focus (SProxy :: SProxy "foo") textbox
    bar <- focus (SProxy :: SProxy "bar") switch
    in { foo, bar }
```
declarations.title: initializer

declarations.comments:
Modify a `FormBuilder` using a (partial) `Iso`.

Technically, we don't require `to (from s) = s`, but we do require
`from (to a) = a` for the form to act sensibly. Since there's no
`PartialIso` in `profunctor-lenses`, we use `Iso` here.

Caveat emptor, you get what you pay for if you pass in a dodgy
`Iso` here.
declarations.title: via

declarations.comments: Focus a `FormBuilder` on a smaller piece of state, using a `Lens`.
declarations.title: focus

declarations.comments:
Focus a `FormBuilder` on a possible type of state, using a `Prism`.

We need two `Prism`s in order to change the result type for
validation purposes.
declarations.title: match

declarations.comments:
Focus a `FormBuilder` on a possible type of state, using a `Prism`,
ignoring validation.
declarations.title: match_

declarations.comments: Make the props available, for convenience.
declarations.title: withProps

declarations.comments: Make the value available, for convenience.
declarations.title: withValue

declarations.comments: Change the props type.
declarations.title: mapProps

declarations.comments: Indent a `Forest` of editors by one level, providing a label.
declarations.title: indent

declarations.comments: Filter parts of the form based on the current value (and the props).
declarations.title: filterWithProps

declarations.comments: TODO: document
declarations.title: withKey

declarations.comments:
Provides default values for primitive data types to be used as initial
values in form builders.

For example:

```purescript
build_ formDefaults ado
  firstName <- focus_ (prop (SProxy :: SProxy "firstName")) textbox
  lastName <- focus_ (prop (SProxy :: SProxy "lastName")) textbox
  in { firstName, lastName }
```
declarations.title: FormDefaults

declarations.comments:
Traverse a tree bottom-up, removing all "internal" nodes (i.e. `Wrapper`
or `Node` constructors) which have empty `children` arrays. In the case
where there's nothing left in the tree after pruning, we return `Nothing`.

We need to perform the traversal bottom-up because, for example, a subtree
such as

```
let
  w children = Wrapper { key: Nothing, children }
in
  w [w []]
```

should be pruned, but a top-down operation would not be able to identify
such a subtree as prunable.
declarations.title: pruneTree

declarations.comments:
An applicative functor which can be used to build forms.
Forms can be turned into components using the `build` function.
declarations.title: FormBuilder

declarations.comments:
A form builder where each field depends on the validity of the previous ones.
That is, every field is only displayed if all the previous ones are valid.
Forms can be turned into components using the `build` function.
declarations.title: SeqFormBuilder

declarations.comments:
Create a `FormBuilder` from a function which produces a form
element as `JSX` and a validated result.
declarations.title: formBuilder

declarations.comments:
The simplest way to create a `FormBuilder`. Create a `FormBuilder`
provided a function that, given the current value and a change callback,
renders a form element as `JSX`.
declarations.title: formBuilder_

declarations.comments:
Invalidate a form, keeping its user interface but discarding the result
and possibly changing its type.
declarations.title: invalidate

declarations.comments:
Revalidate the form, in order to display error messages or create
a validated result.
declarations.title: revalidate

declarations.comments:
Listens for changes in a form's value and allows for performing
asynchronous effects and additional value changes.
declarations.title: listen

declarations.comments:
A `Validator` takes a possibly invalid form `result` and produces
a `valid` result, or an error message.
declarations.title: Validator

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that an input string is non-empty.
declarations.title: nonEmpty

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that an input array is non-empty.
declarations.title: nonEmptyArray

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that an optional field is specified.
declarations.title: nonNull

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input equals some value.
declarations.title: mustEqual

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input fulfills a specified condition.
declarations.title: mustBe

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input can be parsed as a number.
declarations.title: validNumber

declarations.comments: A `Validator` which verifies that its input can be parsed as an integer.
declarations.title: validInt

declarations.comments:
Modify a `Validator` to accept empty strings in addition to anything it
already accepts. The empty string is mapped to `Nothing`, and any other
valid input is mapped to `Just` the result of the original validator.
declarations.title: optional

declarations.comments:
The `Validated` type describes the state of a validated form field. This
state may be used to modify the way this form field or its validation
messages are displayed.

TODO: maybe convert this type to a record? Possible extensions to this
type (as a record) could be a field `valid :: Boolean` to display an
indicator that the field is valid, or a field
`validating :: Maybe (Canceler a)` to control form fields with asynchronous
validation.
declarations.title: Validated

declarations.comments: Lens for viewing and modifying `Validated` values.
declarations.title: _Validated

declarations.comments: Prism for the `Fresh` constructor of `Validated`.
declarations.title: _Fresh

declarations.comments: Prism for the `Modified` constructor of `Validated`.
declarations.title: _Modified

declarations.comments:
Sets all `Validated` fields in a record to `Fresh`, hiding all validation
messages.
declarations.title: setFresh

declarations.comments:
Sets all `Validated` fields in a record to `Modified`, showing all
validation messages.
declarations.title: setModified

declarations.comments:
Internal utility type for modifying the validated state of fields in
records containing `Validated` values.
declarations.title: ModifyValidated

declarations.comments:
Internal utility type class used to flatten repeated applications of
`Validated` to a type.
declarations.title: CanValidate

declarations.comments:
Attach a validation function to a `FormBuilder p u a`, producing a new
`FormBuilder` that takes a `Validated u` as form state and displays an
error message if its form data is invalid.

This `Validated` data type describes a form field as either `Fresh` or
`Modified`, so that validation messages are only displayed if the field
is `Modified`.
declarations.title: validated

declarations.comments:
Attach a validation function to a `FormBuilder p u a`, producing a new
`FormBuilder` that takes a `Validated u` as form state and displays a
warning message if its form data triggers a warning, while still allowing
the form to proceed.
declarations.title: warn

declarations.comments:
This component displays a link which displays an editor component in
a modal popup.
declarations.title: modalLink

declarations.comments:
A `Wizard` is a sequential computation of `FormBuilder`s, representing,
each one, a wizard step that can depend on the result of previous steps to
produce a final result.

`Wizard` is a monadic DSL that contains only a single instruction: `step`.
declarations.title: Wizard

declarations.comments:
Lift a `FormBuilder` and an associated identifier of type `step` into a
`Wizard step`.
declarations.title: step

declarations.comments:
Revalidate a `Wizard`, returning the final result if, with the given
`value`, all steps produce valid results.
declarations.title: revalidate

declarations.comments:
`WizardStep` is a suspended `Wizard` computation, that is, a `Wizard`
whose execution has been stopped at some step. It can be thought of as a
`Wizard` zipper.
declarations.title: WizardStep

declarations.comments:
Retrieve the identifier for the focused step of a `WizardStep`.
Returns `Nothing` if the `WizardStep` represents a finalized `Wizard`.
declarations.title: stepIdentifier

declarations.comments: Lifts a `Wizard` into a `WizardStep` that focuses on its first step.
declarations.title: liftStep

declarations.comments:
Resume a suspended `WizardStep`, if the current step produces a valid
result, returning either the next `WizardStep` or the final result.
declarations.title: resumeStep

declarations.comments: Return the previous step, if there is one.
declarations.title: previousStep

declarations.comments:
Given that the `step` identifiers for the supplied `Wizard` are ordered,
go to the first step in a `Wizard` that is assigned to the given
identifier, if found.
declarations.title: gotoStep

declarations.comments: A component that renders a `WizardStep` (a suspended `Wizard`).
declarations.title: wizard
